p: Agave americana is a plant in the Asparagaceae family with a global occurrence, except the Frigid Zone growing in areas with a range of climates and altitudes. 13 Twenty species and 6 genera of this plant inhabit Ethiopia among 200–300 species found worldwide. 14–16 Even though it is considered an offensive plant in southern parts of Africa, Agave americana is widely cultivated for ornamental purposes because of its pale yellow margin leaves and ease of breeding and cultivation. Seasonal and age-wise variation of some ingredients of the leaves was identified earlier. 13, 15
